channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Massive Lime bike dump on pavements, 9th September
item.description:
Dozens of lime bikes are dumped every day on this pavement, presumably because there is demand from people using the pub nearby. But nearly always the immense number of bikes blocks the way for pedestrians and is is a massive nuisance on the street as they often get moved around, dropped and vandalised. Lime is taking advantage of our public space and profiting from it. This has been going on for many months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Catherall Road, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike dumping on cycle lane, 9th September
item.description:
Every single day. Let me stress that - Every. Single. Day. - dozens of lime bikes are dumped early in the morning along a cycle lane, restricting access for road users and pedestrians alike. This is very bad practice and Lime is taking advantage of public space
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Featherstone Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike thieves operating, 9th September
item.description:
8th September 7pm 3 bike thieves using a electrical saw were cutting bike locks and stealing them in broad daylight. This is the Britannia leisure centre bike racks, but they are in a very concealed area under the trees and likely with no surveillance
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamppost mounted bin is overflowing with dog poo bags, 9th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chesham Road, Penge, London

item.title: Filthy, 9th September
item.description:
